meanings.definition: To make (someone) pleased or less angry by giving or saying something desired
meanings.sent1: She propitiated her upset friend by offering a sincere apology.
meanings.sent2: The child propitiated his mother by cleaning his room without being asked.
meanings.sent3: He propitiated his grumpy cat by giving her extra treats.
meanings.sent4: The magician propitiated the audience with a stunning performance.
meanings.sent5: The student propitiated the teacher by completing all assignments on time.

meanings.definition: To gain or regain the favor or goodwill of
meanings.sent1: The employee propitiated his boss by working hard on the project.
meanings.sent2: She propitiated her neighbor by returning the borrowed tools promptly.
meanings.sent3: The dog propitiated its owner by wagging its tail enthusiastically.
meanings.sent4: The politician propitiated the voters with promises of positive change.
meanings.sent5: The athlete propitiated the coach by showing dedication and improvement.

meanings.sent1: The parent propitiated the crying baby by rocking her gently.
meanings.sent2: He propitiated the angry customer by offering a refund.
meanings.sent3: The chef propitiated the dissatisfied customer by preparing a new dish.
meanings.sent4: The diplomat propitiated the opposing parties with a peace treaty.
meanings.sent5: The friend propitiated the upset friend by listening attentively and offering support.
